intro: Raphiocarpus petelotii, commonly known as the Madagascar starling tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
